Announcments 11/29/2016

  • - Talked about the 40 West and Lakewood. Brian brought large scale drawings, floor plans and 3-d renderings of the Pasternack building sent by Bill Marino. We discussed the options and for people in attendance on the tour of Pasternack a couple of weeks ago the same issues are apparent (being able to transform the space into a gallery and the cost).
  • - Next gallery has already signed a lease agreement with Scott the owner and will moving into the large front area (high ceilings and entry to Colfax). This space is now off the table. We do not know any details about this agreement.
  • - The descion was made, in order to approach Scott with an offer we needed to pick a specific location in the building that would meet our needs. - The only option would be directly behind the Pasternack store and offices that face Colfax in the main building. This is the most complete space that will require work from both Scott and us. As Laura stated if we consider this property we will need to negotiate a below $1 sq foot agreement.
  • - Scott will pay for all utilities and security costs.
  • - We can also cut in our own entry from the parking lot shared with Winchel's donuts.
  • - I do believe we are all in agreement that most people do not want to move to Commerce city.
  • - Phil said Jeanie King understands if we do not move to her location because of the timeline for construction has been delayed. They will break ground in January.
  • - Bill Marino will activity continue to look for potential gallery spaces in Lakewood, but there is nothing at the moment.
  • - Noah provided postcards for the Open Show. They are available at Pirate for distribution.
  • - Bug is bringing beer for the Open Show.
  • - Reminder, the Pirate group show opens December 16. We need to start thinking about marketing this show and Noah who will provide the postcards.
  • - Brian and I scheduled a meeting Thursday morning at 9:30am with Bill Marino to open the building up for us and to take measurements, images, and look at the feasibility of this area behind the Pasternack store.

Meetings

The last Tuesday of each month @ 6:30pm

Members are required to attend!

Associates are strongly encouraged.

Dues

Members $180

Associates $165

Due dates:

- January 1st

- April 1st

- July 1st

- October 1st

Checks should be made payable to Pirate, and either mailed to the gallery address or delivered by hand to the members meeting prior to the due date. Meetings are scheduled for the last Monday of each month.

Promoting your show

It's always cool to meet with the other showing artist get to know eachother, talk about your work, possible collaborations -invite, art curation, food/drinks, etc. :-)

SOCIAL MEDIA:

Facebook: Create an NEW event on Pirates FB -> Invite Pirate followers -> Share event on YOUR FB -> Invite your list of contacts -> Get friends to SHARE event!

https://www.facebook.com/PirateContemporaryArt/

Instagram: Download Instagram on your mobile device -> Get login from Shannon -> Post images of art or project related images with #piratecontemporaryart #pirateartdenver #pirateart #contemporaryart

https://www.instagram.com/piratecontemporaryart/

Invite:

I will be putting up a template for invites which will be your choice to use. But it is not required.

By Appointment

Please include:

  1. Above Pirate Info (REQUIRED)
  2. Opening or Closing Reception: date and time
  3. Show dates
  4. Show title
  5. Your email and website

Evite:

Please send info to - shannon@shannonwkelly.com one month in advance of your show opening.

Please include:

  1. Opening or Closing Reception: date and time
  2. Show dates
  3. Show title
  4. Artist statement or Show statement
  5. One image (no larger than 200kb)

Press:

Should be sent between 1-3 months prior to your show opening.

Denver Post: weekend@denverpost.com

Westword: Michael Paglia- michaelpaglia747@msn.com

Please include:

  1. Opening or Closing Reception: date and time
  2. Show dates
  3. Show title
  4. Artist statement or Show statement
  5. Artist Bio (optional)
  6. Show invitation (optional)
  7. Images with titles (optional)

Denver Arts: http://denverarts.org/submitting_events

Your show

You are responsible to provide any special instructions on your artwork. ex. digital media, mechanical parts, interactive pices, if a piece needs to be watched, etc.

Install:

Clean bathroom and make sure there is supply of TP / soap / paper towls

Sweep and mop after INSTALL

Mops and brooms are located in the hallway closet

Pedestals are located upstairs and in the closet underneath the stairs

Bulbs upstairs. 90w floods and spots

Ladders out-back (keep door proped or you'll get locked out)

Tools and hardware upstairs (best to bring your own)

Opening Night:

Provide food and beverages

Have donations suitcase out (Phil collects nightly)

Make sure the guest book is out

Take out garbage AFTER opening (dumpster in alley)

Sitting:

Memebers two weeks Thursday - Sunday

Associates one week Thursday - Sunday

This can be worked out between the artists

Opening Space:

CLEAN BATHROOM

CLEAN PATIO

Put OUT open sign

Turn ON digital or mechanical art pices OR other special case art needs

Have phone with you

Check for messages on the phone, write a note or call to relay the information

Check the mail; open anything important and pass it on or trash it if it is junk mail

Keep stairway and phone area CLEAR of trash and items that create a tripping hazard

Organize the space between the two galleries; keep clean and remove any old invites laying around (includes mop room)

Closing Space:

Take IN open sign

Turn OFF digital or mechanical art pices OR other special case art needs

Hang up phone

Sweep or mop if necessary

Close ALL doors behind you

Un-Install:

Should be done within 48hrs of show close OR worked out with following artist

Clean bathroom and make sure there is supply of TP / soap / paper towls

Sweep and mop after UN-INSTALL

Putty holes, sand/sponge out putty

Paint any blemishes that may or may not have happened during show

Return pedestals to closet underneath the stairs

Return any gallery modifications back to 100% original state

Take out garbage (dumpster in alley)
